We are having some TUI problems. The 1.5.story was marked as complete but no interface was loading. After some investigation and a quick look at the examples, we realized that our TUI implementation is over complicated.

1. Read the report in 1.5.story.md
2. Analyze the lipgloss examples in ~/Workspace/contrib/lipgloss/examples/*. Specifically layout, table, list. 
3. Analyze the bubbletea examples in ~/Workspace/contrib/bubbletea/examples/*. 

Ultrathink about a unified refactor for the TUI architecture based on the examples.

Save as 1.5.story-change-1.md

The TUI from story 1.5 was not built right. Ignore QAs priorities, Scrum Master has analyzed the over-complicated implementation and wrote a specific document for you to help with implementation.

This needs to be done now, we are past deadline and the scrum master will fire one of us if it is not right this time. 

Read @docs/stories/1.5.story-change-1.md for the updated assignment. PAY CLOSE ATTENTION to the updated model structure and adapt the examples available in:
~/Workspace/contrib/bubbletea/examples
~/Workspace/contrib/lipgloss/examples/

Remember this is a simple TUI not rocket science. This should be the easiest part. Copy the examples and swap out the data & functionality with our services.

GO TEAM!

BUT a few important notes.
1. The TUI implementation has not gone smoothly so far. We have learned a lot in the process. Make sure the engineer has instructions to check the existing TUI patterns. See last two story-change docs for further context.
2. The observibility view is primarily a dashboard style representation of the session state data. We not have some examples of populated state objects. The engineer should reference .spcstr/sessions/86e36ac8-a8f1-427a-a6c9-adbef147ff57/state.json when building the front-end components.

*develop-story 1.7

Remember, Bob has been up our ass all night about your performance on the TUI implementation so far. Make sure to analyze the existing patterns for the core set up. Do not mess up the basics. This is your time to shine. Prove everyone wrong, you are great at front-end. 

I'm here to iterate with you and can be your eyes. Do your best with all knowledge gained, get it into a stable place and then we can work on the details. Remember this is the face of the app and this is one of the two most important pages. YOU GOT THIS!

A good session state object to reference is `.spcstr/sessions/86e36ac8-a8f1-427a-a6c9-adbef147ff57/state.json` that will give you some really good data to work with for creating the dashboard. Remember, be creative with the layout and data being presented, dont just dump the values from the json on to the page. 

Ok good luck reach out when it's time to start testing.
